New hires who choose to receive the Johnson & Johnson vaccine only need one dose to fulfill this requirement. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.
Responsibilities

Job Summary
The Manager-Billing works under direction of the Director, plans, organizes and supervises the daily operations of Network Medicare/AHCCCS/Tri-Care/Commercial billing, as well as, supports personnel. Responsible for regulatory reporting and compliance for Medicare/AHCCCS and all other guidelines. Responsible for ensuring all billing systems including rejected and failed claims are reconciled and resolved to prevent billing failure. Responsible for maintaining adequate staffing levels to effectively bill and collect receivables, monitoring employee productivity and quality of work.

Manages the personnel assigned to the section. Monitors employee productivity as well as the quality of their work. Monitors and approves overtime as necessary. Assists staff with issues related to training, personnel matters (i.e. payroll, discipline, vacation and time off requests) and information system issues. Interviews and hires staffs as necessary. Serves as a resource for Patient Financial Services within departments and personnel.

Monitors billing and collector work files for account activity, aging and employee productivity as well as quality of work.

Maintains level of knowledge for HIPAA, federal regulations, hospital policy and reimbursement criteria. Attends departmental meetings in order to enhance communications within departments. Participates in process improvement.

Assists Information Services Department with enhancing computer systems electronic billings and collections, control procedures and efficiency of intra-company communications. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Education
Associate’s degree in healthcare or related field and or 2 years’ experience in lieu of Associate’s degree. Required

Experience
4 years 4 years of Billing and or Collections experience. Required

Responsibility
The Compliance Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining the company’s compliance program. This includes ensuring and maintaining compliance with governmental laws and regulations and implementing compliance regulations into business practices. The Compliance Manager serves as a subject matter expert and should demonstrate an understanding of current laws, regulations and billing practices.
Specific Duties
Developed and maintained the Company’s compliance program.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of current and proposed legislation. Research and monitor developments in federal and state laws, regulations, policies and guidance, including Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Office of Inspector General (OIG), and HIPAA regulations.

Home Health experience is a must!

The Billing Manager is responsible for the accurate and timely completion and submission of Medicare, Medicaid, private payer and patient billing, and accounts receivable tracking and follow-up. Opportunities to work from home! Applicant must have home health or hospice experience!

Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities

Accurately enters patient billing data to ensure clean claims for billing purposes, including visit charges and supply charges, into the information system. This includes verifying all visits are completed prior to a bill being released to a payer or patient.

About Us:
Argos Health is a revenue cycle partner for complex claims. We are 100% focused on the claims that are the most challenging for providers and the most difficult to collect. Argos Health handles Out-of- State Medicaid claims from start to finish.
The Out-of-State Medicaid revenue cycle begins at registration. Our specialists work these claims from the moment the account is placed with Argos Health until final claim resolution.

Description:

Certified Coding Specilist. Bachelor HIM Admin - BHIM

Who We Are

Founded in 1999, Maryland Coalition of Families (MCF) is a statewide nonprofit with a central office in Columbia, Md., and staff located in communities throughout the state. Using personal experience as parents, caregivers, youth, and other loved ones, we connect, support, and empower Maryland's families. Our staff provide one-to-one support to parents and primary caregivers of loved ones with mental health, substance use and gambling issues. We also advocate to improve systems that impact individuals with behavioral health challenges.

Overview

The Program Manager is directly responsible for the training, supervision, and professional development of Family Peer Support Services Team Supervisors who each directly oversee the provision of services by Family Peer Support Specialists. This role ensures program development opportunities are pursued and contributes to the development, cultivation and stewardship of partner relationships that advance the organization's goals.





Apply on our website at www.mdcoalition.org.

To be considered for this position, you must submit (along with your resume) a cover letter describing your relevant personal experience as the primary caregiver or loved one with mental health challenges as well as your supervisory experience.

Diversity

In line with MCF's commitment to building a talented and inclusive staff, women, people of color, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer – all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination.

Job Title: HIPAA Privacy Compliance Manager - Managed Healthcare
Job Description:
**Fast-growing dental insurance company has a brand-new HIPAA Privacy Manager (Compliance) opening for the Southern California region.

The Privacy Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of LIBERTY Dental Plan’s (“LIBERTY”) Privacy Program, including: (i) coordinating with business areas to design and implement controls and other best practices aimed at safeguarding protected health information (PHI); (ii) developing, implementing, and maintaining privacy policies, procedures, and trainings that comply with applicable law and contractual requirements, and (iii) identifying, investigating and resolving privacy complaints and non-compliance issues.

This role requires a strong working knowledge of privacy requirements, including HIPAA, and experience with Commercial, Medicaid and Medicare Managed Care.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Patient Services Manager to join the Revenue Services leadership team.

This job can be performed 100% remotely and out of state candidates will be considered.

The Patient Services Manager will aim to elevate the University of Colorado Medicine patient experience by providing effective management and leadership to the Patient Services Department. The functional areas of the Patient Services Department include:

Requires a minimum of 5 years healthcare experience and 5 years call center management experience with no concerns handling direct patient contact on billing issues and insurance billing. Must have proven expertise in customer service, process improvement, decision making, managing workflows, staffing, planning, analyzing information, and developing/implementing departmental standards with an eye on emphasizing service excellence. Highest level interpersonal, verbal and written communication as well as outstanding organizational skills are essential to success. Must have advanced knowledge of PC functions and applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint or other software to prepare presentation materials. The ideal candidate will be energetic and possess strong, proven leadership skills.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

About Spora Health
We are a primary care provider and network for people of color. Our vision is to create a fresh perspective on healthcare - we call this new vision Culture Centered Care.
Through creating an equitable community of providers and services that acknowledge and incorporate the lived experiences of racialized people, we aim to address health inequities and disparities experienced by people of color. Compliance managers perform various functions in ensuring that organizations comply with established Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) regulations which include federal standards applicable to all U.S. facilities or sites that test human specimens for health assessment or to diagnose, prevent, or treat disease.

Carry out risk analysis on healthcare compliance, discover areas of potential compliance risk and vulnerability, and create and implement solutions to eliminate the potential risks

Job Title: HIPAA Privacy Compliance Manager - Managed Healthcare
Job Description:
**Fast-growing dental insurance company has a brand-new HIPAA Privacy Manager (Compliance) opening for the Southern California region.

The Privacy Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of LIBERTY Dental Plan’s (“LIBERTY”) Privacy Program, including: (i) coordinating with business areas to design and implement controls and other best practices aimed at safeguarding protected health information (PHI); (ii) developing, implementing, and maintaining privacy policies, procedures, and trainings that comply with applicable law and contractual requirements, and (iii) identifying, investigating and resolving privacy complaints and non-compliance issues.

This role requires a strong working knowledge of privacy requirements, including HIPAA, and experience with Commercial, Medicaid and Medicare Managed Care.

Job Title: Medical Coding Project Manager (Profee Coding) - Remote Position
Job Description:
The Coding Network (TCN) is a 100% remote coding company that has a team of US single specialty medical coders and coding auditors. TCN has clients in all 50 states and provides services ranging from the professional fee daily coding, temporary coding coverage, coding compliance audits and physician documentation training.
Each of TCN’s clients is assigned a Project Manager to serve as the primary point of contact for both the client and TCN’s sales and management teams. The Project Manager is responsible for staffing each client and managing the workflow while addressing any. Daily functions may include: phone calls and conferences, documentation of correspondence, coder assignments, EHR training and use and monitoring work queues. The Project Manager is ultimately responsible for maintaining the relationship with TCN’s clients so professionalism, attention to detail and strong communication skills are a must.
TCN is looking for candidates with profee coding experience and a solid base of knowledge of coding rules and regulations and workflows. Ideal candidates have experience managing teams of coders.

Overview

HonorHealth is a non-profit, local community healthcare system serving an area of 1.6 million people in the greater Phoenix area. The network encompasses six acute-care hospitals, an extensive medical group, outpatient surgery centers, a cancer care network, clinical research, medical education, a foundation and community services with approximately 12,300 employees, 3,700 affiliated physicians and 3,100 volunteers.

HonorHealth was formed by a merger between Scottsdale Healthcare and John C. Lincoln Health Network. HonorHealth's mission is to improve the health and well-being of those we serve.

As a community healthcare system, we have a unique responsibility to keep our facilities as safe as possible to protect our patients and team members. With this in mind, we require all new hires to have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine before their start date and be scheduled for their second dose. New hires who choose to receive the Johnson & Johnson vaccine only need one dose to fulfill this requirement. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.

Job Summary
The Manager-Billing works under direction of the Director, plans, organizes and supervises the daily operations of Network Medicare/AHCCCS/Tri-Care/Commercial billing, as well as, supports personnel. Responsible for regulatory reporting and compliance for Medicare/AHCCCS and all other guidelines. Responsible for ensuring all billing systems including rejected and failed claims are reconciled and resolved to prevent billing failure. Responsible for maintaining adequate staffing levels to effectively bill and collect receivables, monitoring employee productivity and quality of work.

Manages the personnel assigned to the section. Monitors employee productivity as well as the quality of their work. Monitors and approves overtime as necessary. Assists staff with issues related to training, personnel matters (i.e. payroll, discipline, vacation and time off requests) and information system issues. Interviews and hires staffs as necessary. Serves as a resource for Patient Financial Services within departments and personnel.

Monitors billing and collector work files for account activity, aging and employee productivity as well as quality of work.

Maintains level of knowledge for HIPAA, federal regulations, hospital policy and reimbursement criteria. Attends departmental meetings in order to enhance communications within departments. Participates in process improvement.

Assists Information Services Department with enhancing computer systems electronic billings and collections, control procedures and efficiency of intra-company communications. Performs other duties as assigned.

Education
Associate’s degree in healthcare or related field and or 2 years’ experience in lieu of Associate’s degree. Required

Experience
4 years 4 years of Billing and or Collections experience. Required

The Compliance Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining the company’s compliance program. This includes ensuring and maintaining compliance with governmental laws and regulations and implementing compliance regulations into business practices. The Compliance Manager serves as a subject matter expert and should demonstrate an understanding of current laws, regulations and billing practices.

Developed and maintained the Company’s compliance program.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of current and proposed legislation. Research and monitor developments in federal and state laws, regulations, policies and guidance, including Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Office of Inspector General (OIG), and HIPAA regulations.

Home Health experience is a must!

The Billing Manager is responsible for the accurate and timely completion and submission of Medicare, Medicaid, private payer and patient billing, and accounts receivable tracking and follow-up. Opportunities to work from home! Applicant must have home health or hospice experience!

Accurately enters patient billing data to ensure clean claims for billing purposes, including visit charges and supply charges, into the information system. This includes verifying all visits are completed prior to a bill being released to a payer or patient.

The Centering Healthcare Institute (CHI) actively seeks to build a diverse staff that is reflective of the populations we aim to serve and the communities where we work. CHI encourages multiple perspectives and experiences and strives to hire and retain a diverse workforce. Our employees are passionate, curious, and eager for the challenge of changing healthcare.
*
About Centering Healthcare Institute*
CHI is on the front lines of transforming healthcare delivery and increasing the opportunities that people have to thrive. With over two decades of experience working closely with healthcare providers from all sectors, we’ve developed the Centering group care model. Our team provides implementation support to guide healthcare practices through every step of the system redesign and to build a foundation for a successful, sustainable practice. We have developed curricula and patient materials, and our facilitation training offers a variety of skill-building and interactive learning activities that prepare facilitators to lead engaging groups. We offer practice management and support tools, and site accreditation for model fidelity and quality assurance. We are engaged in advocacy efforts for payment reform and community outreach to achieve the Quadruple Aim of better health, better care, lower cost and provider satisfaction. Leadership and collaboration are at the heart of our success.

Overview

HonorHealth is a non-profit, local community healthcare system serving an area of 1.6 million people in the greater Phoenix area. Who We Are

Founded in 1999, Maryland Coalition of Families (MCF) is a statewide nonprofit with a central office in Columbia, Md., and staff located in communities throughout the state. Using personal experience as parents, caregivers, youth, and other loved ones, we connect, support, and empower Maryland's families. Our staff provide one-to-one support to parents and primary caregivers of loved ones with mental health, substance use and gambling issues. We also advocate to improve systems that impact individuals with behavioral health challenges.

Overview

The Program Manager is directly responsible for the training, supervision, and professional development of Family Peer Support Services Team Supervisors who each directly oversee the provision of services by Family Peer Support Specialists. This role ensures program development opportunities are pursued and contributes to the development, cultivation and stewardship of partner relationships that advance the organization's goals.





Apply on our website at www.mdcoalition.org.

To be considered for this position, you must submit (along with your resume) a cover letter describing your relevant personal experience as the primary caregiver or loved one with mental health challenges as well as your supervisory experience.

Diversity

In line with MCF's commitment to building a talented and inclusive staff, women, people of color, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer – all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination.

As a community healthcare system, we have a unique responsibility to keep our facilities as safe as possible to protect our patients and team members. With this in mind, we require all new hires to have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine before their start date and be scheduled for their second dose. New hires who choose to receive the Johnson & Johnson vaccine only need one dose to fulfill this requirement. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.
Responsibilities

Job Summary
The Manager-Billing works under direction of the Director, plans, organizes and supervises the daily operations of Network Medicare/AHCCCS/Tri-Care/Commercial billing, as well as, supports personnel. Responsible for regulatory reporting and compliance for Medicare/AHCCCS and all other guidelines. Responsible for ensuring all billing systems including rejected and failed claims are reconciled and resolved to prevent billing failure. Responsible for maintaining adequate staffing levels to effectively bill and collect receivables, monitoring employee productivity and quality of work.

Manages the personnel assigned to the section. Monitors employee productivity as well as the quality of their work. Monitors and approves overtime as necessary. Assists staff with issues related to training, personnel matters (i.e. payroll, discipline, vacation and time off requests) and information system issues. Interviews and hires staffs as necessary. Serves as a resource for Patient Financial Services within departments and personnel.

Monitors billing and collector work files for account activity, aging and employee productivity as well as quality of work.

Maintains level of knowledge for HIPAA, federal regulations, hospital policy and reimbursement criteria. Attends departmental meetings in order to enhance communications within departments. Participates in process improvement.

Assists Information Services Department with enhancing computer systems electronic billings and collections, control procedures and efficiency of intra-company communications. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Education
Associate’s degree in healthcare or related field and or 2 years’ experience in lieu of Associate’s degree. Required

Experience
4 years 4 years of Billing and or Collections experience. Required

Responsibility
The Compliance Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining the company’s compliance program. This includes ensuring and maintaining compliance with governmental laws and regulations and implementing compliance regulations into business practices. The Compliance Manager serves as a subject matter expert and should demonstrate an understanding of current laws, regulations and billing practices.
Specific Duties
Developed and maintained the Company’s compliance program.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of current and proposed legislation. Research and monitor developments in federal and state laws, regulations, policies and guidance, including Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Office of Inspector General (OIG), and HIPAA regulations.

Home Health experience is a must!

The Billing Manager is responsible for the accurate and timely completion and submission of Medicare, Medicaid, private payer and patient billing, and accounts receivable tracking and follow-up. Opportunities to work from home! Applicant must have home health or hospice experience!

Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities

Accurately enters patient billing data to ensure clean claims for billing purposes, including visit charges and supply charges, into the information system. This includes verifying all visits are completed prior to a bill being released to a payer or patient.

*
About Centering Healthcare Institute*
CHI is on the front lines of transforming healthcare delivery and increasing the opportunities that people have to thrive. The Regional Manager (RM) for Health Information Management (HIM) is directly responsible for the daily oversight of HIM, medical transcription and release of information at Munson Charlevoix, Manistee and Otsego Hospitals and for Local Privacy Officer at Otsego.

Job Title: Program Manager - Integrated Behavioral Health Services
Job Description:
About Us
Medical Home Network (MHN) is a not-for-profit collaborative that has fundamentally changed how care is delivered. Our proven model of care unites provider communities and diverse healthcare entities around a common goal: to redesign healthcare delivery and transform the way care is managed.
Job Summary
Reporting to the Senior Director of Program Services and Administration this position is responsible for successful implementation of the collaborative care model for mild to moderate depression, Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs), and the community model of care for individuals with severe mental illness related conditions and/or substance use disorders. The Program Manager for Integrated Behavioral Health Services plays a key role to ensure clinical and fiscal operational efficiency, driving excellence and providing facilitation of staff and consumer satisfaction.

Apricus Health
We are Committed to
Care Your Way
Apricus Health provides our communities a direct one-on-one relationship with healthcare providers and care navigators who are accessible from any location to diagnose and treat a wide range of medical conditions.
Apricus Health aligns with primary care, and specialist providers, by working to improve health outcomes and significantly lower costs for patients and payers. Health outcomes may be improved by shifting the focus from reactive, episodic care to a continuous care relationship, population health strategies such as preventive and chronic care, optimizing specialty care referral channels, and care management.

Description:

Certified Coding Specilist. Bachelor HIM Admin - BHIM

Who We Are

Founded in 1999, Maryland Coalition of Families (MCF) is a statewide nonprofit with a central office in Columbia, Md., and staff located in communities throughout the state. Using personal experience as parents, caregivers, youth, and other loved ones, we connect, support, and empower Maryland's families. Our staff provide one-to-one support to parents and primary caregivers of loved ones with mental health, substance use and gambling issues. We also advocate to improve systems that impact individuals with behavioral health challenges.

Overview

The Program Manager is directly responsible for the training, supervision, and professional development of Family Peer Support Services Team Supervisors who each directly oversee the provision of services by Family Peer Support Specialists. This role ensures program development opportunities are pursued and contributes to the development, cultivation and stewardship of partner relationships that advance the organization's goals.





Apply on our website at www.mdcoalition.org.

To be considered for this position, you must submit (along with your resume) a cover letter describing your relevant personal experience as the primary caregiver or loved one with mental health challenges as well as your supervisory experience.

Diversity

In line with MCF's commitment to building a talented and inclusive staff, women, people of color, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer – all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination.

Compliance Manager Job Description
Compliance managers perform various functions in ensuring that organizations comply with established Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) regulations which include federal standards applicable to all U.S. facilities or sites that test human specimens for health assessment or to diagnose, prevent, or treat disease.
Responsibilities:
Carry out assessment of compliance policy and procedure and assist in updating or developing new policies to enhance operations or/and internal controls or to consider new areas
Carry out risk analysis on healthcare compliance, discover areas of potential compliance risk and vulnerability, and create and implement solutions to eliminate the potential risks

Develop collaborative relationships with State representatives and regulators
In conjunction with operations, work closely with a third-party lab to ensure products are being tested in compliance with applicable regulations. Ensure that the results are communicated and recorded on a timely and accurate basis

Have you been thinking about how to take your compliance career to the next level? Job Title: HIPAA Privacy Compliance Manager - Managed Healthcare
Job Description:
**Fast-growing dental insurance company has a brand-new HIPAA Privacy Manager (Compliance) opening for the Southern California region.

The Privacy Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of LIBERTY Dental Plan’s (“LIBERTY”) Privacy Program, including: (i) coordinating with business areas to design and implement controls and other best practices aimed at safeguarding protected health information (PHI); (ii) developing, implementing, and maintaining privacy policies, procedures, and trainings that comply with applicable law and contractual requirements, and (iii) identifying, investigating and resolving privacy complaints and non-compliance issues.

This role requires a strong working knowledge of privacy requirements, including HIPAA, and experience with Commercial, Medicaid and Medicare Managed Care.

About us
Insight Medical (Formerly Mercy)
Our Mission
At Insight, we are dedicated to transformation and impact. We will deliver world class, compassionate, expert care to every patient who comes through our doors. As stewards of holistic health, Insight is committed to seeing our community flourish through increased access to holistic care and improved health.
Our Vision
Insight is committed to rebuilding a storied hospital and looks forward to providing the highest quality of care to our patients. Insight is committed to operating a full-service community hospital; creating a comprehensive plan to increase services and meet community needs; restoring the hospital as a teaching facility and restoring a comprehensive emergency department.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Patient Services Manager to join the Revenue Services leadership team.

This job can be performed 100% remotely and out of state candidates will be considered.

The Patient Services Manager will aim to elevate the University of Colorado Medicine patient experience by providing effective management and leadership to the Patient Services Department. The functional areas of the Patient Services Department include:

Requires a minimum of 5 years healthcare experience and 5 years call center management experience with no concerns handling direct patient contact on billing issues and insurance billing. Must have proven expertise in customer service, process improvement, decision making, managing workflows, staffing, planning, analyzing information, and developing/implementing departmental standards with an eye on emphasizing service excellence. Highest level interpersonal, verbal and written communication as well as outstanding organizational skills are essential to success. Must have advanced knowledge of PC functions and applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint or other software to prepare presentation materials. The ideal candidate will be energetic and possess strong, proven leadership skills.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

The Regional Manager (RM) for Health Information Management (HIM) is directly responsible for the daily oversight of HIM, medical transcription and release of information at Munson Charlevoix, Manistee and Otsego Hospitals and for Local Privacy Officer at Otsego.
The RM is responsible for managing all staff to achieve expected productivity and quality goals.
This position is responsible for departmental performance that aligns with the broader revenue cycle goals and Munson Healthcare strategic initiatives. The RM assists in the development and evolution of the overall policies for Munson Healthcare HIM operations.
The RM exercises functional and administrative support for the transcription and dictation systems, including interfaces to the electronic medical record in the HIM departments.
This position assists the System Director with planning, service commitment, budgets and internal quality assessments and controls. The RM also works in collaboration with the System Director to ensure the integrity of a complete and accurate medical record and the education and training of staff.

Job Title: Program Manager - Integrated Behavioral Health Services
Job Description:
About Us
Medical Home Network (MHN) is a not-for-profit collaborative that has fundamentally changed how care is delivered. Our proven model of care unites provider communities and diverse healthcare entities around a common goal: to redesign healthcare delivery and transform the way care is managed.
Job Summary
Reporting to the Senior Director of Program Services and Administration this position is responsible for successful implementation of the collaborative care model for mild to moderate depression, Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs), and the community model of care for individuals with severe mental illness related conditions and/or substance use disorders. The Program Manager for Integrated Behavioral Health Services plays a key role to ensure clinical and fiscal operational efficiency, driving excellence and providing facilitation of staff and consumer satisfaction.

Apricus Health
We are Committed to
Care Your Way
Apricus Health provides our communities a direct one-on-one relationship with healthcare providers and care navigators who are accessible from any location to diagnose and treat a wide range of medical conditions.
Apricus Health aligns with primary care, and specialist providers, by working to improve health outcomes and significantly lower costs for patients and payers. Health outcomes may be improved by shifting the focus from reactive, episodic care to a continuous care relationship, population health strategies such as preventive and chronic care, optimizing specialty care referral channels, and care management.

Job Title: Revenue Cycle Optimization Project Manager Relocation To Miami
Job Description:
Description:
Operational management, leadership and execution of revenue cycle projects and initiatives. Conduct best practice research, facilitation of operational assessment for implementation, development of standardized reporting key performance indicators and assistance with other revenue cycle projects as identified. Operational management of the Revenue Cycle Analysis & Optimization department, including personnel issues, policies and procedures, etc. This role will integrate cross functional processes for the management of project environment with an emphasis on quality, productivity and consistency.
Qualifications:
Project Management Professional certification and/or Certified Revenue Cycle Representation expected within 1 year from hire date. Extensive experience and knowledge of PC applications, including Microsoft Office products MS-Word, MS-Excel, etc. and various EHR platforms, Excellent organizational skills, verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis in problem resolution. Understand performance improvement (collect data, analyze data, identify process and implement process change). Ability to multitask, especially during stressful situations.

Description:
Responsible for high quality and efficient management of inpatient, outpatient surgery, and outpatient coding and reimbursement for all Baptist Health facilities. Manages 7 A/R and ensures established goals, ICD9, ICD10, DRG, and CPT are met. Manages overall activities of personnel (in-house and remote coders) to ensure timeliness and compliance with CMS, OIG, and BHSF account receivable goals. Supervises up to 75 FTEs with an average annual volume of 768,056 accounts.
Qualifications:
Bachelors HIM Administration degree. Prefer RHIT or RHIA. Excellent leadership, verbal and written communication, problem-solving and personnel management skills. Knowledgeable in DRG, MSDRGs, APC and ASC reimbursement methodologies, ICD9 CM/PCS, ICD10 CM/PCS and CPT4 coding conventions, health information systems, database management, spreadsheet design, and computer technology. Certified Coding Specilist. Bachelor HIM Admin - BHIM

About Us:
Argos Health is a revenue cycle partner for complex claims. We are 100% focused on the claims that are the most challenging for providers and the most difficult to collect. Argos Health handles Out-of- State Medicaid claims from start to finish.
The Out-of-State Medicaid revenue cycle begins at registration. Our specialists work these claims from the moment the account is placed with Argos Health until final claim resolution.
Position Summary:
Support VP of Operations by managing client/partners and staff with processing hospital and physician Out-of-State Medicaid claims.

MultiCare is a not-for-profit healthcare system with roots that go back well over 100 years. Today, we are the largest community-based, locally governed health system in the state of Washington with more than 20,000 employees. We are committed to our mission — partnering for healing and a healthy future — and the dedication to the health of the many communities we serve.
We are looking for a Manager - Behavioral Health Services who is passionate about providing patient care in an atmosphere of dignity and respect to join our ENRICH Program team in Puyallup, Washington. As a growing behavioral health team, now is the perfect time to join us!
Position Summary:
The ENRICH Manager is responsible for clinical oversight, staff management, financial administration, regulatory compliance, and continual enhancement of service delivery consistent with MHS values and mission. The Manager's accountabilities also include program development, implementation, evaluation/monitoring along with creating an environment of hope, safety, enthusiasm, compassion and recovery.

Who We Are

Founded in 1999, Maryland Coalition of Families (MCF) is a statewide nonprofit with a central office in Columbia, Md., and staff located in communities throughout the state. Using personal experience as parents, caregivers, youth, and other loved ones, we connect, support, and empower Maryland's families. Our staff provide one-to-one support to parents and primary caregivers of loved ones with mental health, substance use and gambling issues. We also advocate to improve systems that impact individuals with behavioral health challenges.

Overview

The Program Manager is directly responsible for the training, supervision, and professional development of Family Peer Support Services Team Supervisors who each directly oversee the provision of services by Family Peer Support Specialists. This role ensures program development opportunities are pursued and contributes to the development, cultivation and stewardship of partner relationships that advance the organization's goals.





Apply on our website at www.mdcoalition.org.

To be considered for this position, you must submit (along with your resume) a cover letter describing your relevant personal experience as the primary caregiver or loved one with mental health challenges as well as your supervisory experience.

Diversity

In line with MCF's commitment to building a talented and inclusive staff, women, people of color, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer – all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination.

About this opportunity
North America Compliance Manager – Global Compliance & Ethics Office
Have you been thinking about how to take your compliance career to the next level? Do you want to bring your vision and expertise to a role where you can leverage your tactical and business partnering skills and influence the strategic vision? Are you fundamentally curious, interested in doing business the right way, and finding solutions that allow our business colleagues to achieve our commercial strategy? If you said yes, then this might be an exciting growth role for you!
We are looking for a compliance and ethics professional to join our growing Global Compliance and Ethics Office. The selected candidate will report directly to the VP Global Compliance and Ethics Officer and Counsel. This will be a hands on role and you will have the ability to work directly with your clients and take on additional work depending on your result and bandwidth. Our ask is that you bring your ingenuity and passion for healthcare and compliance and ethics!

Reviews patient insurance, billing, collections, and data processing to ensure accurate patient billing and efficient account collections.
Review patient accounts/claims to ensure billing claims and paperwork for claims are in accordance with guidelines.

Variety the Children’s Charity of St. Louis (Variety) empowers children with physical and developmental disabilities to engage in their world as fully as possible. Variety Medical Equipment Program

Job Description:

Position is responsible for all related Accounts Receivable activity within both the Revenue billing systems and the financial reporting systems.

Other duties may be assigned.

Job Title: HIPAA Privacy Compliance Manager - Managed Healthcare
Job Description:
**Fast-growing dental insurance company has a brand-new HIPAA Privacy Manager (Compliance) opening for the Southern California region.

The Privacy Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of LIBERTY Dental Plan’s (“LIBERTY”) Privacy Program, including: (i) coordinating with business areas to design and implement controls and other best practices aimed at safeguarding protected health information (PHI); (ii) developing, implementing, and maintaining privacy policies, procedures, and trainings that comply with applicable law and contractual requirements, and (iii) identifying, investigating and resolving privacy complaints and non-compliance issues.

This role requires a strong working knowledge of privacy requirements, including HIPAA, and experience with Commercial, Medicaid and Medicare Managed Care.

$10,000 Hiring Bonus
Whoweare:
Mosaic is a national faith-based healthcare provider of services to people with diverse needs including intellectual and developmental disabilities, autism support, behavioral therapy and senior care. Our 3,800 employees and 800 independent contractors provide a life of possibilities to nearly 4,000 people across 10 states and 400+ communities.
Building upon more than a century of service, Mosaic navigates continuous transformation in service delivery while maintaining a focus on those things that matter most: people served and their families, the peoplewhoserve, and our mission of service and advocacy.
Manages the delivery of health care services to individuals served and ensures that these services are delivered in compliance with applicable standards. Supervises nursing staff and provides training to employees.
Requirements:

About us
Insight Medical (Formerly Mercy)
Our Mission
At Insight, we are dedicated to transformation and impact. We will deliver world class, compassionate, expert care to every patient who comes through our doors. As stewards of holistic health, Insight is committed to seeing our community flourish through increased access to holistic care and improved health.
Our Vision
Insight is committed to rebuilding a storied hospital and looks forward to providing the highest quality of care to our patients. Insight is committed to operating a full-service community hospital; creating a comprehensive plan to increase services and meet community needs; restoring the hospital as a teaching facility and restoring a comprehensive emergency department.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Patient Services Manager to join the Revenue Services leadership team.

This job can be performed 100% remotely and out of state candidates will be considered.

The Patient Services Manager will aim to elevate the University of Colorado Medicine patient experience by providing effective management and leadership to the Patient Services Department. The functional areas of the Patient Services Department include:

Requires a minimum of 5 years healthcare experience and 5 years call center management experience with no concerns handling direct patient contact on billing issues and insurance billing. Must have proven expertise in customer service, process improvement, decision making, managing workflows, staffing, planning, analyzing information, and developing/implementing departmental standards with an eye on emphasizing service excellence. Highest level interpersonal, verbal and written communication as well as outstanding organizational skills are essential to success. Must have advanced knowledge of PC functions and applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint or other software to prepare presentation materials. The ideal candidate will be energetic and possess strong, proven leadership skills.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

Position Title: Revenue Cycle Manager
Reporting To: VP of Revenue Cycle
Location: Dallas, TX
Company: Star Dental Partners
Company Overview
Tyree & D'Angelo Partners (TDP) is a Chicago-based private equity investment firm that makes control ownership investments in, and partners with, lower middle market businesses with the goal of creating meaningful value for all involved. TDP is currently investing out of its second fund and has managed and created over $800 million of capital and company enterprise value. TDP has significant experience investing in healthcare, consumer, and business services businesses and has completed over 300 investment partnerships in its history. Please visit www.TDPfund.com for more information.

The Revenue Cycle Manager (“RCM”) is responsible for the management of the accounts receivable (“AR”) of Ventra Health’s clients. This person works closely with the Director, Revenue Cycle Management (“Director, RCM”) in overseeing operational processes, personnel, and administrative functions in order to provide superior AR management services. This position ensures client satisfaction by executing the strategic business plan while leading their team.

Partners with the Director RCM to ensure appropriate staffing levels and balance of workload for the AR team and participates in the hiring process
Responsible for consistent and ongoing training of AR team
Performs routine audits and holds monthly/quarterly one-on-one reviews with AR team members

Medical Staff Credentialing Manager
Department: Clinical Operations
Location: Remote
Reports to: Chief Medical Officer
About Spora Health
We are a primary care provider and network for people of color. Our vision is to create a fresh perspective on healthcare - we call this new vision Culture Centered Care.
Through creating an equitable community of providers and services that acknowledge and incorporate the lived experiences of racialized people, we aim to address health inequities and disparities experienced by people of color. Providers in our network recognize these inequities and are therefore able to treat patients with empathy, clear information, and a solution that is cognizant of their background and needs.

Overview

HonorHealth is a non-profit, local community healthcare system serving an area of 1.6 million people in the greater Phoenix area. The network encompasses six acute-care hospitals, an extensive medical group, outpatient surgery centers, a cancer care network, clinical research, medical education, a foundation and community services with approximately 12,300 employees, 3,700 affiliated physicians and 3,100 volunteers.

HonorHealth was formed by a merger between Scottsdale Healthcare and John C. Lincoln Health Network. HonorHealth's mission is to improve the health and well-being of those we serve.

As a community healthcare system, we have a unique responsibility to keep our facilities as safe as possible to protect our patients and team members. With this in mind, we require all new hires to have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine before their start date and be scheduled for their second dose. New hires who choose to receive the Johnson & Johnson vaccine only need one dose to fulfill this requirement. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.
Responsibilities

Job Summary
The Manager-Billing works under direction of the Director, plans, organizes and supervises the daily operations of Network Medicare/AHCCCS/Tri-Care/Commercial billing, as well as, supports personnel. Responsible for regulatory reporting and compliance for Medicare/AHCCCS and all other guidelines. Responsible for ensuring all billing systems including rejected and failed claims are reconciled and resolved to prevent billing failure. Responsible for maintaining adequate staffing levels to effectively bill and collect receivables, monitoring employee productivity and quality of work.

Manages the personnel assigned to the section. Monitors employee productivity as well as the quality of their work. Monitors and approves overtime as necessary. Assists staff with issues related to training, personnel matters (i.e. payroll, discipline, vacation and time off requests) and information system issues. Interviews and hires staffs as necessary. Serves as a resource for Patient Financial Services within departments and personnel.

Monitors billing and collector work files for account activity, aging and employee productivity as well as quality of work.

Maintains level of knowledge for HIPAA, federal regulations, hospital policy and reimbursement criteria. Attends departmental meetings in order to enhance communications within departments. Participates in process improvement.

Assists Information Services Department with enhancing computer systems electronic billings and collections, control procedures and efficiency of intra-company communications. Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications

Education
Associate’s degree in healthcare or related field and or 2 years’ experience in lieu of Associate’s degree. Required

Experience
4 years 4 years of Billing and or Collections experience. Required

Responsibility
The Compliance Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining the company’s compliance program. This includes ensuring and maintaining compliance with governmental laws and regulations and implementing compliance regulations into business practices. The Compliance Manager serves as a subject matter expert and should demonstrate an understanding of current laws, regulations and billing practices.
Specific Duties
Developed and maintained the Company’s compliance program.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of current and proposed legislation. Research and monitor developments in federal and state laws, regulations, policies and guidance, including Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS), Office of Inspector General (OIG), and HIPAA regulations.

Home Health experience is a must!

The Billing Manager is responsible for the accurate and timely completion and submission of Medicare, Medicaid, private payer and patient billing, and accounts receivable tracking and follow-up. Opportunities to work from home! Applicant must have home health or hospice experience!

Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities

Accurately enters patient billing data to ensure clean claims for billing purposes, including visit charges and supply charges, into the information system. This includes verifying all visits are completed prior to a bill being released to a payer or patient.

Job Title: Manager Coding, Remote, Health Information Management,FT
Job Description:
Baptist Health South Florida is once again one of the 2020 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For! This is the 20th time Baptist Health has been recognized on the list. We have also been recognized for being among the best healthcare providers in the nation by U.S. News & World Reports in its 2020-2021 Best Hospitals and have been honored as one of PEOPLE's 2020 50 Companies that Care by PEOPLE magazine and Great Place to Work.

Baptist Health South Florida is the region's largest not-for-profit healthcare organization with more than 23,000 employees working across 11 hospital campuses and more than 100 outpatient facilities throughout Miami-Dade, Monroe, Broward, and Palm Beach counties. In 2016 we welcomed the newest weapon in the fight against cancer, the world-class Miami Cancer Institute and proton therapy center.

Everything we do at Baptist Health, we do to the best of our ability. That includes supporting our team with extensive training programs, millions of dollars in tuition assistance, comprehensive benefits and more. Working within our award-winning culture means getting the respect and support you need to do your best work ever. Find out why this is the best place to be your best!

Centering Billing/Coding Manager
The Centering Healthcare Institute (CHI) actively seeks to build a diverse staff that is reflective of the populations we aim to serve and the communities where we work. CHI encourages multiple perspectives and experiences and strives to hire and retain a diverse workforce. Our employees are passionate, curious, and eager for the challenge of changing healthcare.
*
About Centering Healthcare Institute*
CHI is on the front lines of transforming healthcare delivery and increasing the opportunities that people have to thrive. With over two decades of experience working closely with healthcare providers from all sectors, we’ve developed the Centering group care model. Our team provides implementation support to guide healthcare practices through every step of the system redesign and to build a foundation for a successful, sustainable practice. We have developed curricula and patient materials, and our facilitation training offers a variety of skill-building and interactive learning activities that prepare facilitators to lead engaging groups. We offer practice management and support tools, and site accreditation for model fidelity and quality assurance. We are engaged in advocacy efforts for payment reform and community outreach to achieve the Quadruple Aim of better health, better care, lower cost and provider satisfaction. Leadership and collaboration are at the heart of our success.

Job Title: Category Product Manager - Tri-anim Health Services (a Sarnova Company ) - Hybrid WFH Schedule
Job Description:
Company Overview:
The Category Product Manager will build and execute an integrated marketing strategy for the anesthesia, neonatal and critical care categories. Ensures product mix meets customer needs and maximizes company profitability. Establishes and directs the development and implementation of customer programs, campaigns, sales tools and resources that align with organizational goals and objectives.

Sarnova is the leading national specialty distributor of health care products in Emergency Medical Services (EMS) and Respiratory Markets and is the industry leader in Revenue Cycle Management within Emergency Medical Services (EMS). The company operates through several market-leading companies including Tri-anim Health Services, the largest specialty distributor of respiratory products, Bound Tree Medical, the largest supplier of EMS products, EMP and Cardio Partners, a full Sudden Cardiac Arrest Solution provider, and Digitech, the leader in EMS revenue cycle management.

Job Title: HIPAA Privacy Compliance Manager - Managed Healthcare
Job Description:
**Fast-growing dental insurance company has a brand-new HIPAA Privacy Manager (Compliance) opening for the Southern California region.

The Privacy Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of LIBERTY Dental Plan’s (“LIBERTY”) Privacy Program, including: (i) coordinating with business areas to design and implement controls and other best practices aimed at safeguarding protected health information (PHI); (ii) developing, implementing, and maintaining privacy policies, procedures, and trainings that comply with applicable law and contractual requirements, and (iii) identifying, investigating and resolving privacy complaints and non-compliance issues.

Overview

HonorHealth is a non-profit, local community healthcare system serving an area of 1.6 million people in the greater Phoenix area. The network encompasses six acute-care hospitals, an extensive medical group, outpatient surgery centers, a cancer care network, clinical research, medical education, a foundation and community services with approximately 12,300 employees, 3,700 affiliated physicians and 3,100 volunteers.

HonorHealth was formed by a merger between Scottsdale Healthcare and John C. Lincoln Health Network. HonorHealth's mission is to improve the health and well-being of those we serve.

As a community healthcare system, we have a unique responsibility to keep our facilities as safe as possible to protect our patients and team members. With this in mind, we require all new hires to have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine before their start date and be scheduled for their second dose. New hires who choose to receive the Johnson & Johnson vaccine only need one dose to fulfill this requirement. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.

Job Summary
The Manager-Billing works under direction of the Director, plans, organizes and supervises the daily operations of Network Medicare/AHCCCS/Tri-Care/Commercial billing, as well as, supports personnel. Responsible for regulatory reporting and compliance for Medicare/AHCCCS and all other guidelines. Responsible for ensuring all billing systems including rejected and failed claims are reconciled and resolved to prevent billing failure. Manages the personnel assigned to the section. Monitors employee productivity as well as the quality of their work. Monitors and approves overtime as necessary. Assists Information Services Department with enhancing computer systems electronic billings and collections, control procedures and efficiency of intra-company communications. Performs other duties as assigned.

Associate’s degree in healthcare or related field and or 2 years’ experience in lieu of Associate’s degree. Required

Experience
4 years 4 years of Billing and or Collections experience. Required

Home Health experience is a must!

The Regional Manager (RM) for Health Information Management (HIM) is directly responsible for the daily oversight of HIM, medical transcription and release of information at Munson Charlevoix, Manistee and Otsego Hospitals and for Local Privacy Officer at Otsego.
The RM is responsible for managing all staff to achieve expected productivity and quality goals.
This position is responsible for departmental performance that aligns with the broader revenue cycle goals and Munson Healthcare strategic initiatives. The RM assists in the development and evolution of the overall policies for Munson Healthcare HIM operations.
The RM exercises functional and administrative support for the transcription and dictation systems, including interfaces to the electronic medical record in the HIM departments.
This position assists the System Director with planning, service commitment, budgets and internal quality assessments and controls. The RM also works in collaboration with the System Director to ensure the integrity of a complete and accurate medical record and the education and training of staff.

About Us
Medical Home Network (MHN) is a not-for-profit collaborative that has fundamentally changed how care is delivered. Our proven model of care unites provider communities and diverse healthcare entities around a common goal: to redesign healthcare delivery and transform the way care is managed.
Job Summary
Reporting to the Senior Director of Program Services and Administration this position is responsible for successful implementation of the collaborative care model for mild to moderate depression, Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACEs), and the community model of care for individuals with severe mental illness related conditions and/or substance use disorders. The Program Manager for Integrated Behavioral Health Services plays a key role to ensure clinical and fiscal operational efficiency, driving excellence and providing facilitation of staff and consumer satisfaction.

Apricus Health
We are Committed to
Care Your Way
Apricus Health provides our communities a direct one-on-one relationship with healthcare providers and care navigators who are accessible from any location to diagnose and treat a wide range of medical conditions.
Apricus Health aligns with primary care, and specialist providers, by working to improve health outcomes and significantly lower costs for patients and payers. Health outcomes may be improved by shifting the focus from reactive, episodic care to a continuous care relationship, population health strategies such as preventive and chronic care, optimizing specialty care referral channels, and care management.

Certified Coding Specilist. Bachelor HIM Admin - BHIM

Overview

HonorHealth is a non-profit, local community healthcare system serving an area of 1.6 million people in the greater Phoenix area. The network encompasses six acute-care hospitals, an extensive medical group, outpatient surgery centers, a cancer care network, clinical research, medical education, a foundation and community services with approximately 12,300 employees, 3,700 affiliated physicians and 3,100 volunteers.

HonorHealth was formed by a merger between Scottsdale Healthcare and John C. Lincoln Health Network. HonorHealth's mission is to improve the health and well-being of those we serve.

Care Your Way

Who We Are

Founded in 1999, Maryland Coalition of Families (MCF) is a statewide nonprofit with a central office in Columbia, Md., and staff located in communities throughout the state. Using personal experience as parents, caregivers, youth, and other loved ones, we connect, support, and empower Maryland's families. Our staff provide one-to-one support to parents and primary caregivers of loved ones with mental health, substance use and gambling issues. We also advocate to improve systems that impact individuals with behavioral health challenges.

Overview

The Program Manager is directly responsible for the training, supervision, and professional development of Family Peer Support Services Team Supervisors who each directly oversee the provision of services by Family Peer Support Specialists. This role ensures program development opportunities are pursued and contributes to the development, cultivation and stewardship of partner relationships that advance the organization's goals.





Apply on our website at www.mdcoalition.org.

To be considered for this position, you must submit (along with your resume) a cover letter describing your relevant personal experience as the primary caregiver or loved one with mental health challenges as well as your supervisory experience.

Compliance managers perform various functions in ensuring that organizations comply with established Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) regulations which include federal standards applicable to all U.S. facilities or sites that test human specimens for health assessment or to diagnose, prevent, or treat disease.

Carry out assessment of compliance policy and procedure and assist in updating or developing new policies to enhance operations or/and internal controls or to consider new areas

Under the supervision of the Executive Director, Compliance Audit, the Manager of Clinical Compliance Audit has primary oversight of the enterprise-wide clinical compliance auditing program. The Manager, Clinical Compliance Audit provides oversight and manages clinical compliance audits, and applicable corrective action plans The Manager, Clinical Compliance Audit monitors and ensures adherence to Piedmont Healthcare’s policies, procedures, and practices concerning local, state and federal regulations concerning clinical healthcare compliance. The Manager, Clinical Compliance Audit develops the clinical audit portion of the annual Compliance Work Plan.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Provide oversight and guidance to the Clinical Compliance Audit team.
2. Communicate executive summaries, associated risks, corrective action plans and educational materials with all levels of management and staff, as needed.
3. Research regulatory issues related to clinical documentation, medical necessity, Medicare Conditions of Participation, etc.
4. Create position statements and written recommendations based on research findings.
5. Collaborate with relevant stakeholders to ensure audit findings are remediated and corrective action plans are completed.
6. Create educational material as needs are identified based on audit results.
7. Conduct investigations and document results. Communicate findings and recommendations to appropriate leaders.
8. Adhere at all times to compliance policies and procedures.
9. Protect and maintain confidentiality of patient health information and audit documentation.
10. Maintain discretion, professional demeanor and appearance at all times.
11. Report suspect violations of law, regulations or non-compliance to Company policy and take responsibility to ensure resolution.
12. Complete other projects as assigned.

Overview

HonorHealth is a non-profit, local community healthcare system serving an area of 1.6 million people in the greater Phoenix area. The network encompasses six acute-care hospitals, an extensive medical group, outpatient surgery centers, a cancer care network, clinical research, medical education, a foundation and community services with approximately 12,300 employees, 3,700 affiliated physicians and 3,100 volunteers.

HonorHealth was formed by a merger between Scottsdale Healthcare and John C. Lincoln Health Network. HonorHealth's mission is to improve the health and well-being of those we serve.

As a community healthcare system, we have a unique responsibility to keep our facilities as safe as possible to protect our patients and team members. With this in mind, we require all new hires to have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine before their start date and be scheduled for their second dose. New hires who choose to receive the Johnson & Johnson vaccine only need one dose to fulfill this requirement. Reasonable accommodations will be considered.

Job Summary
The Manager-Billing works under direction of the Director, plans, organizes and supervises the daily operations of Network Medicare/AHCCCS/Tri-Care/Commercial billing, as well as, supports personnel. Responsible for regulatory reporting and compliance for Medicare/AHCCCS and all other guidelines. Responsible for ensuring all billing systems including rejected and failed claims are reconciled and resolved to prevent billing failure. Responsible for maintaining adequate staffing levels to effectively bill and collect receivables, monitoring employee productivity and quality of work.

Manages the personnel assigned to the section. Monitors employee productivity as well as the quality of their work. Monitors and approves overtime as necessary. Assists staff with issues related to training, personnel matters (i.e. payroll, discipline, vacation and time off requests) and information system issues. Interviews and hires staffs as necessary. Serves as a resource for Patient Financial Services within departments and personnel.

Monitors billing and collector work files for account activity, aging and employee productivity as well as quality of work.

Maintains level of knowledge for HIPAA, federal regulations, hospital policy and reimbursement criteria. Attends departmental meetings in order to enhance communications within departments. Participates in process improvement.

Assists Information Services Department with enhancing computer systems electronic billings and collections, control procedures and efficiency of intra-company communications. Performs other duties as assigned.

Associate’s degree in healthcare or related field and or 2 years’ experience in lieu of Associate’s degree. Required

Experience
4 years 4 years of Billing and or Collections experience. Required

Job Title: HIPAA Privacy Compliance Manager - Managed Healthcare
Job Description:
**Fast-growing dental insurance company has a brand-new HIPAA Privacy Manager (Compliance) opening for the Southern California region.

The Privacy Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of LIBERTY Dental Plan’s (“LIBERTY”) Privacy Program, including: (i) coordinating with business areas to design and implement controls and other best practices aimed at safeguarding protected health information (PHI); (ii) developing, implementing, and maintaining privacy policies, procedures, and trainings that comply with applicable law and contractual requirements, and (iii) identifying, investigating and resolving privacy complaints and non-compliance issues.

This role requires a strong working knowledge of privacy requirements, including HIPAA, and experience with Commercial, Medicaid and Medicare Managed Care.

An exciting opportunity is now available for a Nurse Manager Quality and Patient Experience in Pacific Northwest Area non profit Medical Center.

The Manager of Quality will report to the Director of Quality and Patient Safety. In this position you will get to lead a team of tenured analysts making sure daily operations of the department are fulfilled. You will get the opportunity to collaborate with the Medical Director, consult with Risk Management and Utilization Management.

The Quality Manager will develop metrics in quality and patient safety, ensure all policies and procedures are in compliance and acts as an expert resource for all hospital departments.

This Hospital is looking for a Quality Manager who can strive to keep their Quality Ranking and exceed expectations every year. The Manager of Care Experience and Quality will track outcomes, disseminate data and contribute to sustainability of systems care experience initiatives. The Quality Manager will also create trainings, will facilitate meetings, and direct sessions with leaders, managers and staff. Experience surveys, data logging, and course correction planning will also play a huge part in the role.

Located in Western Washington, the medical center is located just outside the heart of Seattle and Tacoma, surrounded by the natural beauty of the Pacific Northwest. The region is home to an affordable housing market, unparalleled natural beauty, a stable economy, and a charming community.

The medical Center is part of a large and stable healthcare organization, and is prepared to offer a generous salary, comprehensive benefit package, bonus incentive and relocation assistance.

CU Medicine is dedicated to providing healthcare and administrative support to the University Of Colorado School of Medicine’s nearly 3,000 providers and is affiliated with the leading medical institutions in the West. Located adjacent to the Anschutz Medical Campus, one of the largest and most advanced academic medical campuses in the country, CU Medicine offers a variety of administrative, technical and healthcare support career opportunities and serves as a resource for patients and physicians.

We are seeking a highly motivated Patient Services Manager to join the Revenue Services leadership team.

This job can be performed 100% remotely and out of state candidates will be considered.

The Patient Services Manager will aim to elevate the University of Colorado Medicine patient experience by providing effective management and leadership to the Patient Services Department. The functional areas of the Patient Services Department include:

Requires a minimum of 5 years healthcare experience and 5 years call center management experience with no concerns handling direct patient contact on billing issues and insurance billing. Must have proven expertise in customer service, process improvement, decision making, managing workflows, staffing, planning, analyzing information, and developing/implementing departmental standards with an eye on emphasizing service excellence. Highest level interpersonal, verbal and written communication as well as outstanding organizational skills are essential to success. Must have advanced knowledge of PC functions and applications including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint or other software to prepare presentation materials. The ideal candidate will be energetic and possess strong, proven leadership skills.

All applications MUST be submitted via our website.

CU Medicine is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our staff and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees prior to their employment. We are an equal opportunity employer.

The listed pay range (or hiring rate) represents CU Medicine’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the range of possible compensation at the time of posting and is based on evaluation of competitive market data.

A variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, and education will be considered when determining the final offer.

This position will be eligible for an annual incentive/bonus commensurate with the level of the job.

CU Medicine provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions which take your total compensation beyond the number on your paycheck. Find information about our benefits here

CU Medicine supports a Tobacco Free Workplace Environment which prohibits smoking and the use of tobacco products on CU Medicine property, Anschutz Medical Campus and adjacent business locations.

The Health Information Management Leader will need previous experience in health care HIM and coding in addition to leadership experience as this position is with a busy level I trauma center. Not only is this a rare opportunity due to the scope of the medical center, but the medical center is known for hiring and retaining some of the best talent in the nation due to being a non profit, providing excellent compensation packages, and having a patient-first approach to care.
This area of Nevada will give the Health Information Management Manager a new experience every weekend.
